resources.string: Blight

The blight is a curse of earth, and being of the earth also makes it a curse of the body as well. The fiends in Edengrove are infected by it, but the blight infects the human body as well. It weakens you, pulling you closer to death with every breath. Be careful, you must prepare a proper defense against it when in blighted areas of Edengrove.
"Uh... What is an 'Outpost Rush'?"

Outpost Rush is a 20 vs 20 match that takes place on a large island with three Outposts.\nPlayers compete to capture and hold these Outposts for as long as possible, increasing their team's score in the process.
"I am looking for someone, actually."
Oh? Well, I am afraid I cannot help you there. I arrived only this morning and I do not know a single name!
"Will any other newcomers be there?"
Well… we did have one young woman at our table last night, but I am not certain if she will choose to stay. If you ask me, she seemed rather attached to her mother.
"Have you met a young woman named Han Liu?"
I have. Is she a friend of yours? You might want to speak to the High Seer if you would like to join her. I believe she departed for her walk in the dark hours of the morning.
"I am looking for a woman named Han Liu."

Ah, Miss Liu. A promising young spark, that one. She walks the path of truth now. If she returns, I am sure she will be glad to see you after such a trial. We all eagerly await the outcome of her communion.
"I'm ready to learn more."

I can tell you, or you can see for yourself. Follow the path to the north as it mounts the peak. Imbue these seeds in a pool's waters and plant them in soft soil.\n\nIf you are swift, you may join Miss Liu.
<Speak the Oath.>

"I stand before my fellows, humbled by nature's majesty.

I came with many questions, and I seek only answers.

I give myself to the unknown, in hopes of renewing my body and soul.

What may be, will be."
"I'm not sure I am ready for this. Are you?"

I think so. I have read everything available to me in the enclave. I have spoken at length to the High Sage. I think I know enough about the ritual to escape an unpleasant death.\n\nAll the same… come with me?
"She survived, but she chose to join them."

It is as I feared.\n\nI have already asked so much of you… but could you stay with her? Convince them you intend to join as well? I cannot imagine leaving her alone with them. Her mind is so… malleable.
"Here is what I collected."
Thank you. I have asked a great deal of you. It is time now for you to rest.\n\nGo now and meditate on all that you have seen.
"Can you tell me more about this cult?"

If I were to write a pamphlet, I would wax eloquent about balance, simplicity, a life free from greed.\n\nBut you are here, among us. Stay. Share our meals. Listen to our stories. Our ways are open to any and all.
"What's with the mask?"

I have a profoundly ugly face.\n\nNo, pardon my jest. I chose this mask to reinforce that I am nothing, indeed I am no ONE, but a conduit for the ethos of the Cult. It matters not who I am, only what I may offer.
"Are you the High Sage?"
I am, though it is not a title I would have chosen for myself. I was drawn here, just like the others, but I feel I have come closest to articulating why.\n\nPerhaps that is why they chose me.
"Lilian said you could give me a drink…?"
I take it they ah… stepped out… as it were. Here, go on, I'll put it on their tab.
"Are you Ranger Yasin's 'Love'?"
He might think so. My blooms do have this effect on humans, sometimes. I will collect him.\n\nThe cure is gruesome, but effective. Harvest some Blight and bring it to my grotto. I will mark your map.
